publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3701 Margaret Curran: Swinton Primary Supports Fairtrade Fortnightâ€”That the Parliament praises Swinton Primary School in Baillieston, Glasgow, for hosting a coffee morning on Friday 6 March to raise awareness of Fairtrade Fortnight and the work undertaken by the Fairtrade Foundation and particularly commends the engagement of the young pupils with the issue of fair trade and the hard work invested by pupils, staff and parents to make it such a great event.

S3M-3701 Swinton Primary Supports Fairtrade Fortnight (lodged on 13 March 2009) Cathy Jamieson*, Helen Eadie*, Karen Gillon*, Sarah Boyack*, Des McNulty*, Mary Mulligan*, Ken Macintosh*, James Kelly*, Patrick Harvie*, Bob Doris*, Patricia Ferguson*

S3M-3701 Swinton Primary Supports Fairtrade Fortnight (lodged on 13 March 2009) Jamie Hepburn*, Karen Whitefield*, Bill Kidd*, Pauline McNeill*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Jackie Baillie*
S3M-3701 Swinton Primary Supports Fairtrade Fortnight (lodged on 13 March 2009) David Stewart*, Trish Godman*, Johann Lamont*, Robin Harper*
S3M-3701 Swinton Primary Supports Fairtrade Fortnight (lodged on 13 March 2009) Jack McConnell*
S3M-3701 Swinton Primary Supports Fairtrade Fortnight (lodged on 13 March 2009) Gil Paterson*
S3M-3701 Swinton Primary Supports Fairtrade Fortnight (lodged on 13 March 2009) Hugh Henry*
S3M-3701 Swinton Primary Supports Fairtrade Fortnight (lodged on 13 March 2009) Stuart McMillan*
